com.namics.oss.spring.support.i18n.text

Class SqlScriptWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.namics.oss.spring.support.i18n.text.SqlScriptWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextWriter

    public class SqlScriptWriter
extends Object
implements TextWriter
    TextWriter implementation to write preconfigured SQL scripts. Usually the configuration is analog to SimpleJdbcMessageSourceDao
    Since:
    Namics commons i18n 1.3 - Oct 18, 2010
    Author:
    aschaefer, namics ag

    • Field Detail

      • scriptTemplate

        protected org.springframework.core.io.Resource scriptTemplate
        Template to use for script generation. To use a custom template you can create a plain text file. This file must contain a placeholder ##BODY## to define where the body should be placed. There is a default template provided with this artifact that can be resolved by a class loader: classpath:templates/template.sql If you have annotation processing enabled for this package, this template will be autowired.

      • scriptTemplateContent

        protected String scriptTemplateContent
        Template to use for script generation. To use a custom template you can create a plain text file. This file must contain a placeholder ##BODY## to define where the body should be placed.

      • insertStatementTemplate

        protected String insertStatementTemplate
        String to create an INSERT statement to insert a single message in a specific language. During script generation process the following placeholders are resolved:
        • ##TABLE## the table name is replaced with parameter table
        • ##MESSAGE## the message column name is replaced with parameter message
        • ##CODEID##the codeId column name is replaced with parameter codeId
        • ##LANGID##the langId column name is replaced with parameter langId
        For a working compatible statement the following is required:
        • parameter for the message is named :message
        • parameter for the codeId is named :codeid
        • parameter for the langId is named :langid
        • parameter for the type is named :type
        The preconfigured default is: INSERT INTO ##TABLE## (##CODEID##, ##LANGID## ,##MESSAGE##) VALUES (:codeid,:langid,:message,:type)

      • bodyPlaceholder

        protected String bodyPlaceholder
        The placeholder used in template to place the content.

      • table

        protected String table
        value to replace placeholder ##TABLE##.

      • codeId

        protected String codeId
        value to replace placeholder ##CODEID##.

      • langId

        protected String langId
        value to replace placeholder ##LANGID##.

      • message

        protected String message
        value to replace placeholder ##MESSAGE##.

      • type

        protected String type
        value to replace placeholder ##TYPE##.

      • lineBreak

        protected String lineBreak
        Character to use for line breaks - current system property line.separator is default .

      • placeholders

        protected Map<String,String> placeholders
        With this map further placeholders can be configured to be replaced in the Templates. This might be useful when you have more complex structures in the database.
        Using this mechanism you can configure specific setups like environment dependency. Be careful with placeholders and make sure that they are unique and recognizable. You can use a pattern like ##PLACEHOLDER##.
        There are RESERVED placeholders that are replaced with configured values before evaluation of this map:
        • ##TABLE##
        • ##MESSAGE##
        • ##LANGID##
        • ##CODEID##

      • encoding

        protected String encoding
        Encoding used to write data.
